Originally intended for designated marksmen in every basic Soviet infantry unit, the Dragunov SVD was not designed for specialised sniper teams. Relatively light for a sniper rifle but well-balanced and having semiautomatic fire, its precision is good but not exceptional. It has an effective range of up to 800 metres.

 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: KZRZP suppressor (after modification)

Dragunov sniper rifle with folding stock - the SVDS variant. Was specially designed for Russian paratroopers and special forces units.

Dragunov sniper rifle with folding stock - the SVDS variant. Was specially designed for Russian paratroopers and special forces units. In the Zone similar models are usually used by mercenaries, Ukrainian special forces, various PMCs and other power structures for conducting special operations.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes: All scopes for Picatinny/weaver except of red dot sights.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: Rotor 43
 %c[ui_gray_2] The kit includes:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Rotor 43 thread adapter for SVD-S,
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] SAG MK1 Freefloat Chassis for SVD,
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Zenit foregrip RK-5 (short) for very good recoil control,
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Custom SVDS dust cover,
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Zenit RK3 pistol grip,
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Universal mount by NcStar that allows installing the auxiliary sight at 45 degrees angle with Trijicon RMR red dot sight installed on it.
